comment._content: wow! i didn't knew that such treasures exist in Flickr! well done guys ;)

comment.author: 70556674@N00
comment._content: I guess nothing changes - taxi drivers are dodgy. Public transport should have priority over cars. A taxi did a U-turn in front of a tram I was on and it was a write off. I took some photos: www.flickr.com/photos/furphy/213015383/ and the taxi www.flickr.com/photos/furphy/213015543 -- Seen on your photo stream. (?)

comment.author: 8793648@N06
comment._content: For admirers of Sam Hood's photos, there is a book  - Sydney Exposures, Through the eyes of Sam Hood & his studio 1925 - 1950, [probably] published by the State Library of NSW,

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: Yes - this book was published by us and was written by our curator of photograhs, Alan Davies. If you are looking for a location of this book near you, you can use this link on World Cat.
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 24052676@N03
comment._content: We have trams near me and there are still collisions with cars & people - still not looking.

comment.author: 22616984@N07
comment._content: In the NLA newspaper articles, tram accidents seem to have been disturbingly common. I couldn't find a reference to this particular "minor" incident. The most serious accident in Sydney for 1937 involved the deaths of 6 people.

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: Pitt Street appears to be one-way even back as far as 1937.
